description: With the ICJ upholding India’s plea on Jadhav, Pakistan must grant consular access
title: Upheld at The Hague: Pakistan must act responsibly

author: Al Jazeera
description: UN court orders Pakistan to stay the execution of Jadhav, a retired Indian naval officer, in a setback to Islamabad.
title: ICJ orders Pakistan to stay Kulbhushan Jadhav execution

author: PTI
description: Pakistan Rangers violated the ceasefire again on Wednesday by firing on forward posts along the LoC in Balakote sector of Jammu of Kashmir.“Pakistan army resorted to firing on forward posts along the
title: Pakistan violates ceasefire in Balakote,1700 shifted to safer areas

author: Iain Marlow
description: The International Court of Justice has ordered Pakistan to halt the execution of a former Indian naval officer pending a final decision in the proceedings.
title: UN Court Orders Pakistan to Halt Execution of Indian Man

description: The range and scope of the plan is breathtaking, showing a deep penetration into Pakistan’s economic life. This could have several implications for India – Pakistan’s sovereignty could be forfeited to Chinese interests and China would be uncomfortably close to India’s borders in the east and west.
title: Beijing plans to turn Pakistan into its economic colony - Times of India

description: The ICJ had yesterday stayed the execution of 46-year-old Jadhav, who was sentenced to death last month by a Pakistan military court that convicted him of alleged spying and subversive activities. The retired Indian Navy officer has been in Pakistan custody for more than a year.
title: No information from Pakistan on Kulbhushan Jadhav's condition - Times of India

description: The ICJ instructed Pakistan to take all "necessary measures at its disposal" to ensure that Jadhav was not executed pending a final decision by it. Pakistan was in shock as it was confident that the ICJ will throw out the case on the grounds of jurisdiction.
title: Pakistan does not accept ICJ's jurisdiction in national security matters: Foreign Office - Times of India

author: Saeed Shah
description: The Trump administration has spoken with Pakistan about the prospect of freeing Dr. Shakil Afridi, who helped the U.S. find and kill Osama bin Laden, and whose imprisonment in Pakistan has been a persistent thorn in relations.
title: U.S. and Pakistan Discuss Release of Doctor Who Helped Find Osama bin Laden

description: Pakistan Foreign Office spokesman Nafees Zakaria said that Pakistan has been underscoring for decades the risks of diversion by India of imported nuclear fuel, equipment and technology, received pursuant to civil nuclear cooperation agreements and the 2008 NSG waiver.
title: India has been diverting nuclear materials to make weapons: Pakistan - Times of India

author: Dhananjay Mahapatra
description: “Salve showed that Pakistan had granted conditional access to Jadhav by linking this case to an unrelated issue.  But during the argument, Pakistan said the convention did not apply to spies of one country arrested by the other and this had been agreed to in a bilateral agreement. Only one fact could be correct, either access to Jadhav could be granted, conditional or otherwise, or it was barred. Both cannot be true,” a source said.
title: Pakistan’s arguments in ICJ inconsistent, says India - Times of India
